{
  "talents": [
    {
      "id": "talent_accurate_shot",
      "name": "Accurate Shot",
      "max": "Ballistic Skill Bonus",
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You are an exceptional shot. You deal extra damage equal to your Accurate Shot level (the number of times you have taken this talent) with all ranged weapon attacks."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_acute_sense",
      "name": "Acute Sense (Sense)",
      "max": "Initiative Bonus",
      "tests": "Perception (Sense)",
      "description": "One of your five senses is highly developed. You must choose a specific sense (e.g., Sight, Hearing, Smell) for each time you take this talent. You can make Perception tests to notice details that would normally be imperceptible with that sense."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_aethyric_attunement",
      "name": "Aethyric Attunement",
      "max": "Initiative Bonus",
      "tests": "Channelling (Any)",
      "description": "You can more safely manipulate the Winds of Magic. You do not suffer a Miscast if you roll a double on a successful Channelling Test."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_alley_cat",
      "name": "Alley Cat",
      "max": "Initiative Bonus",
      "tests": "Stealth (Urban)",
      "description": "You are at home in urban shadows. When using the Stealth (Urban) skill, you may reverse the dice of any failed test if doing so would result in a success."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_ambidextrous",
      "name": "Ambidextrous",
      "max": 2,
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You have superior coordination with your off-hand.\nFirst Time: The penalty for using your secondary hand is reduced from –20 to –10.\nSecond Time: You suffer no penalty at all for using your secondary hand."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_animal_affinity",
      "name": "Animal Affinity",
      "max": "Willpower Bonus",
      "tests": "Charm Animal",
      "description": "Wild animals are comfortable in your presence. Creatures with the Bestial trait that are not trained for aggression will be calm around you unless provoked."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_arcane_magic",
      "name": "Arcane Magic (Lore)",
      "max": 1,
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You study a specific Lore of Magic (e.g., Beasts, Fire, Hedgecraft). You may now learn and memorize spells from that Lore by spending XP. You cannot normally learn more than one Arcane Magic talent, nor can you learn the Bless or Invoke talents."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_argumentative",
      "name": "Argumentative",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Charm (when arguing/debating)",
      "description": "You excel at winning arguments. When you make a successful Charm Test as part of a debate, you can choose to use either your normal SL or the number rolled on the units die of your d100 roll as your SL. (e.g., a roll of 24 could be used for +4 SL)."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_artistic",
      "name": "Artistic",
      "max": "Dexterity Bonus",
      "tests": "Art (Any)",
      "description": "You have a natural talent for art. You can add the Art (Any) skill to any career you enter. If it is already part of the career, you may purchase Advances in it for 5 XP fewer per Advance."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_attractive",
      "name": "Attractive",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Charm (to influence those attracted to you)",
      "description": "You know how to use your good looks. When you make a successful Charm Test to influence someone who would be attracted to you, you can choose to use either your normal SL or the number rolled on the units die of your d100 roll as your SL. (e.g., a roll of 38 could be used for +8 SL)."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_battle_rage",
      "name": "Battle Rage",
      "max": "Willpower Bonus",
      "tests": "Melee (when Frenzied)",
      "description": "You have better control over your combat rages. You can attempt to end your Frenzy with a successful Cool Test at the end of any round."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_beat_blade",
      "name": "Beat Blade",
      "max": "Weapon Skill Bonus",
      "tests": "Melee (for a Beat Blade)",
      "description": "As your Action, you can make a special, unopposed Melee Test to strike an opponent's weapon. If successful, your opponent loses 1 Advantage, plus 1 additional Advantage for every SL you score. This does not work against unarmed opponents or those of a larger Size category."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_beneath_notice",
      "name": "Beneath Notice",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Stealth (when in plain sight)",
      "description": "You are easily ignored by your social superiors. Those in a higher Status Tier will generally not notice you unless you act inappropriately. Furthermore, characters of a higher Status Tier gain no Advantage for striking or wounding you in combat."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_berserk_charge",
      "name": "Berserk Charge",
      "max": "Strength Bonus",
      "tests": "Melee (on a round when you Charge)",
      "description": "You throw yourself into the attack with wild abandon. When you perform a Charge, you gain +1 Damage to all your Melee attacks for each time you have this Talent."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_blather",
      "name": "Blather",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Charm (to Blather)",
      "description": "You can confuse and confound a target with rapid, nonsensical talk. Make an Opposed Charm/Intelligence Test. If you win, your opponent gains 1 Stunned Condition, plus 1 additional Stunned Condition for each time you have this Talent. The target can do nothing but stare at you dumbfounded while Stunned in this way. The effect ends if you stop talking."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_bless",
      "name": "Bless (Divine Lore)",
      "max": 1,
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You are watched over by a specific deity and can enact their minor miracles. You must choose a single Divine Lore (e.g., Sigmar, Shallya, Ulric). You can now use the Pray skill to perform the Blessings associated with that deity."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_bookish",
      "name": "Bookish",
      "max": "Intelligence Bonus",
      "tests": "Research",
      "description": "You are highly adept at navigating libraries and archives. When using the Research skill, you may reverse the dice of any failed test if doing so would result in a success."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_break_and_enter",
      "name": "Break and Enter",
      "max": "Strength Bonus",
      "tests": "Melee (when forcing or breaking inanimate objects)",
      "description": "You are an expert at forcing entry. You add +1 Damage for each time you have this Talent when making Melee attacks against inanimate objects like doors, chests, and windows."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_briber",
      "name": "Briber",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Bribery",
      "description": "You are an exceptionally skilled negotiator of illicit payments. The GM should reduce the base cost of any required bribe by 10% for each time you have this Talent, to a minimum of 10% of the original asking price."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_cardsharp",
      "name": "Cardsharp",
      "max": "Intelligence Bonus",
      "tests": "Gamble and Sleight of Hand (when playing card games)",
      "description": "You are a master of card games, both fair and foul. When you make a successful Gamble or Sleight of Hand test while playing cards, you can choose to use either your normal SL or the number rolled on the units die of your d100 roll as your SL."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_careful_strike",
      "name": "Careful Strike",
      "max": "Initiative Bonus",
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You are skilled at precisely placing your attacks. You may modify your final Hit Location roll by up to ±10 for each time you have this Talent."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_carouser",
      "name": "Carouser",
      "max": "Toughness Bonus",
      "tests": "Charm (at Parties), Gossip (at Parties), Consume Alcohol",
      "description": "You are a seasoned party animal. You may reverse the dice of any failed Consume Alcohol Test if doing so would result in a success."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_catfall",
      "name": "Catfall",
      "max": "Agility Bonus",
      "tests": "Athletics (when falling)",
      "description": "You are as nimble as a cat. When you fall, you may make an Athletics Test. If successful, you reduce the distance fallen by 1 yard, plus 1 additional yard per SL, for the purposes of calculating damage."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_cat_tongued",
      "name": "Cat-tongued",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Charm (when lying)",
      "description": "You are a gifted and convincing liar. When you use the Charm skill to tell a lie, your targets are not allowed to make an Opposed Test with their Intuition skill to sense your deception."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_chaos_magic",
      "name": "Chaos Magic (Lore)",
      "max": "Number of spells in chosen Lore",
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You have pledged a part of your soul to a Dark God in exchange for foul magic. Choose a Chaos Lore (e.g., Nurgle, Slaanesh, Tzeentch). You immediately learn one spell from that lore and gain 1 Corruption Point. Each subsequent time you take this talent (at a cost of 100 XP), you learn another spell from that lore and gain another Corruption Point."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_combat_aware",
      "name": "Combat Aware",
      "max": "Initiative Bonus",
      "tests": "Perception (during melee)",
      "description": "You are adept at maintaining situational awareness in the chaos of battle. You may make a Challenging (+0) Perception Test to ignore the Surprised condition."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_combat_master",
      "name": "Combat Master",
      "max": "Agility Bonus",
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "Your experience allows you to effectively handle multiple opponents. When you are outnumbered in melee, you count as one additional person for each time you have this Talent for the purposes of calculating outnumbering bonuses."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_combat_reflexes",
      "name": "Combat Reflexes",
      "max": "Initiative Bonus",
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You react with incredible speed. When determining your initiative score at the start of combat, add +10 to your Initiative characteristic for each time you have this Talent."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_commanding_presence",
      "name": "Commanding Presence",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Leadership",
      "description": "You possess an undeniable aura of authority. When you use the Leadership skill, individuals of a lower Social Status may not oppose your test with their Willpower. This does not apply to enemies or those who would not normally respect your station."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_concoct",
      "name": "Concoct",
      "max": "Intelligence Bonus",
      "tests": "Lore (Apothecary)",
      "description": "You are skilled at creating potions and draughts with limited resources. You may perform one free Crafting Endeavour using Lore (Apothecary) without needing a workshop."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_contortionist",
      "name": "Contortionist",
      "max": "Agility Bonus",
      "tests": "Perform and Agility Tests (when contorting helps)",
      "description": "You can bend and twist your body in seemingly unnatural ways, allowing you to squeeze through tight gaps or perform other feats of flexibility, often requiring an Agility Test."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_coolheaded",
      "name": "Coolheaded",
      "max": 1,
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You are naturally calm and composed. You gain a permanent +5 bonus to your starting Willpower characteristic. This bonus does not count as an Advance."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_crack_the_whip",
      "name": "Crack the Whip",
      "max": "Dexterity Bonus",
      "tests": "Drive or Ride (when Fleeing or Running)",
      "description": "You know how to push your animals to their limits. When an animal you are controlling is Fleeing or Running, it gains +1 Movement, provided you are using a whip."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_craftsman",
      "name": "Craftsman (Trade)",
      "max": "Dexterity Bonus",
      "tests": "Trade (any one)",
      "description": "You have a natural talent for a specific trade. You must choose one Trade specialisation. You can add that Trade skill to any career you enter. If it is already part of the career, you may purchase Advances in it for 5 XP fewer per Advance."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_criminal",
      "name": "Criminal",
      "max": "None",
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You are an active criminal. This provides a bonus to your income from illegal sources during downtime Endeavours. However, because of your obvious criminal nature (e.g., tattoos, shifty demeanor), others consider you to be of a lower Status unless they are also Criminals. Law enforcement is always suspicious of you."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_deadeye_shot",
      "name": "Deadeye Shot",
      "max": 1,
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You are a master of the called shot. When making a ranged attack, instead of reversing the dice to determine the Hit Location, you may choose any location you wish to hit."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_dealmaker",
      "name": "Dealmaker",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Haggle",
      "description": "You are a skilled negotiator. When using the Haggle skill, you increase or decrease the price of goods by an additional 10%."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_detect_artefact",
      "name": "Detect Artefact",
      "max": "Initiative Bonus",
      "tests": "Intuition (to detect magical artefacts)",
      "description": "You can sense the presence of magic in objects. By touching an item, you may make an Intuition Test. If successful, you sense that the item is magical. Each additional SL reveals one of the item's specific magical properties or special rules."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_diceman",
      "name": "Diceman",
      "max": "Intelligence Bonus",
      "tests": "Gamble and Sleight of Hand (when playing dice games)",
      "description": "You are a master of dice games. When you make a successful Gamble or Sleight of Hand test while playing dice, you can choose to use either your normal SL or the number rolled on the units die of your d100 roll as your SL."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_dirty_fighting",
      "name": "Dirty Fighting",
      "max": "Weapon Skill Bonus",
      "tests": "Melee (Brawling)",
      "description": "You know all the dishonorable tricks of unarmed combat. When you hit with a Melee (Brawling) attack, you may choose to inflict extra damage equal to the number of times you have this Talent. Using this in a formal bout is considered cheating."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_disarm",
      "name": "Disarm",
      "max": "Initiative Bonus",
      "tests": "Melee (for a Disarm)",
      "description": "As your Action, you can attempt to disarm an opponent by making an Opposed Melee/Melee Test.\nWin: Your opponent's weapon is knocked 1d10 feet in a random direction.\nWin by 2+ SL: You choose how far the weapon is thrown.\nWin by 4+ SL: You also choose the direction it is thrown.\nWin by 6+ SL: You can catch the weapon if you have a free hand.\nThis talent does not work on unarmed opponents or those of a larger Size."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_distract",
      "name": "Distract",
      "max": "Agility Bonus",
      "tests": "Athletics (to Distract)",
      "description": "You can use your Move to perform a distraction. This is resolved with an Opposed Athletics/Cool Test. If you win, your opponent cannot gain any Advantage until the end of the next round."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_doomed",
      "name": "Doomed",
      "max": 1,
      "tests": "None",
      "description": "You were given a specific prophecy about your death by a Priest of Morr. Work with the GM to define this Dooming. If your character dies in a way that fulfills this prophecy, your next character starts with a bonus of half the total XP your deceased character had earned."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_drilled",
      "name": "Drilled",
      "max": "Weapon Skill Bonus",
      "tests": "Melee (when beside an ally with Drilled)",
      "description": "You are trained to fight in formation. If an enemy causes you to lose Advantage while you are standing next to an active ally who also has the Drilled talent, you may keep 1 Advantage for each time you have taken this talent."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_dual_wielder",
      "name": "Dual Wielder",
      "max": "Agility Bonus",
      "tests": "Melee or Ranged (when attacking with two weapons)",
      "description": "When armed with two weapons, you can use your Action to attack with both.\n1. Make your primary hand attack as normal.\n2. If it hits, you may then use the *reversed* dice roll of that attack as the to-hit roll for your secondary weapon against any valid target. This second attack is opposed normally and suffers the standard off-hand penalty.\n3. All your defensive tests suffer a –10 penalty until your next turn. You only gain Advantage if both attacks hit."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_embezzle",
      "name": "Embezzle",
      "max": "Intelligence Bonus",
      "tests": "Intelligence (Embezzling)",
      "description": "You are skilled at skimming money. When you receive income, you may make an Opposed Intelligence Test against your employer. If you win, you skim an amount of money determined by the GM based on the business's size. If your employer wins by 6+ SL, you get the money but are caught."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_enclosed_fighter",
      "name": "Enclosed Fighter",
      "max": "Agility Bonus",
      "tests": "Dodge (in enclosed environments)",
      "description": "You are adept at fighting in tight spaces. You ignore all penalties to Melee tests caused by confined environments and can use the Dodge skill even where it would normally be disallowed."
    },
    {
      "id": "talent_etiquette",
      "name": "Etiquette (Social Group)",
      "max": "Fellowship Bonus",
      "tests": "Charm and Gossip (Social Group)",
